newsitem.title: SENEGAL: Malaysians look to invest in Senegal tax-free zone.
newsitem.headline: Malaysians look to invest in Senegal tax-free zone.

text.p: A Malaysian investment company has offered to buy a slice of Senegal's tax free zone for use as an industrial park and tourist complex, the Senegalese administrator of the zone said on Tuesday.

Kuala Lumpur-based Halaman Perdana said in its investment plan it wanted to use 300 hectares for an industrial park for dozens of firms and 500 hectares as a tourist complex with an international golf course, a country club, bungalows and a wharf.
"We have not responded yet to the offer of the Malaysians, but we are studying it very seriously," Amadou Maleine Niang, director of Senegal's industrial tax free zone told Reuters.
The Malaysians had not yet disclosed how much they are willing to pay, he said. The project could take up to 15 years to complete, he added.
Amadou Maleine Niang said the company had a similar industrial and tourist project in the Chinese industrial zone of Shenzhen.
